0.title: Rahul Gandhi introduced to K-pop by Kerala's BTS Army, video surfaces
0.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had his first lesson in the Korean music genre K-pop and popular band BTS from a group of schoolgirls in Kerala on Tuesday during Congress' ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The schoolgirls told Gandhi that they wanted to become nurses and work in South Korea and also played a BTS music video for the Congress leader.

1.title: Serentica Renewables in talks to enter green energy generation
1.article_body: Pratik Agarwal, director of Serentica Renewables, said that the company is in talks to scale up its green energy generation capacity to 1,500 MW. The company recently secured a deal with three Vedanta Group companies to supply 580 MW of green power. Agarwal also said the group is in talks with potential investors for investment across green energy.

2.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Suryakumar Yadav overtakes Babar Azam
2.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Suryakumar Yadav overtaking Pakistan's Babar Azam. Suryakumar is now ranked third with 780 rating points, while Babar is fourth with 771 rating points. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan leads the rankings with 825 rating points. Suryakumar is the only Indian in the top 10.

3.title: CBI arrests ABG Shipyard founder-chairman Rishi Agarwal in ₹22,842-crore bank fraud case
3.article_body: The CBI arrested the founder-chairman of ABG Shipyard Limited, Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal, in connection with an alleged bank fraud of ₹22,842 crore. The company was sanctioned credit facilities from 28 banks and financial institutions led by ICICI Bank, with SBI having an exposure of ₹2,468.51 crore. Funds were used for purposes other than for which they were released, officials said.

4.title: Protests at Pune university over irregularities in exam results, fees
4.article_body: Yuvak Kranti Dal and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad held two separate protests at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) on Tuesday against the irregularities related to semester exam results, fees and facilities. They also demanded the appointment of a full-time Vice-Chancellor at SPPU. Minister Chandrakant Patil has instructed the appointment of a nodal officer to hear students' demands.

5.title: SRK shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra': Ranbir Kapoor
5.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed that Shah Rukh Khan shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra'. "We all are actors and when we are asked to do guest appearances, it's usually one day or two days which we agree to do, but...he shot for 10 days," Ranbir stated. Director Ayan Mukerji added that they owe Shah Rukh "a lot".

6.title: DRI seizes 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth ₹33 cr from Mumbai, Delhi
6.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth over ₹33 crore from Mumbai, Delhi and Patna, which was smuggled from neighbouring countries, according to a statement issued on Wednesday. Under the 'Op Gold Rush', 120 gold bars were seized from Mumbai, 172 from Bihar and 102 from Delhi.

7.title: Youth trying to stop drug mafia's operations beaten to death in Punjab
7.article_body: A young boy trying to stop a drug smuggler from selling drugs in Punjab's Tarn Taran was allegedly beaten to death by the smuggler's men on Wednesday. The victim's family claims that the youth was kept in confinement for two days and that they also received death threats from the smuggler. Police have identified the accused through the crime's video.

8.title: Class 10 Pune boy selected to participate in NASA-led competition
8.article_body: Sonit Sisolekar, a 15-year-old Class 10 student in Pune has been selected to participate in the Great Lunar Expedition for Everyone (GLEE) 2023, a NASA-led competition. Sisolekar said, "Though volcanology is my primary interest, GLEE has given me an opportunity to read about...volcanic activity on the lunar surface." He's a recipient of the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar of 2021.

9.title: Pretty impressive: Verstappen on Red Bull's in-house engines for 2026
9.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said his team Red Bull's project to build its power units in-house for the 2026 season is "pretty impressive". "I hear all the stories from Christian (Horner) and Helmut (Marko)...It's pretty impressive what they're doing there at the moment, and what's to come," said Verstappen. Red Bull won the 2021 driver's championship with Honda engines.

10.title: Today, you made me cry for 1st time: Kapil Sharma on Raju Srivastava
10.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Instagram and mourned the loss of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away on Wednesday. Kapil shared a picture with Raju and wrote, "Today, for the first time, you made me cry Raju bhai. I wish there would have been one more chance to meet you." Raju passed away at the age of 58.

11.title: JD(U) MLC detained, interrogated by Income Tax Dept at Patna airport
11.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) Department detained JD(U) MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh at Bihar's Patna airport on Tuesday night and interrogated him for three hours. After the interrogation, IT officials were seen leaving the airport with a sealed suitcase. However, Singh said, "They did not find anything, any money, as there was nothing to be found." Singh represents Bihar's Muzaffarpur constituency.

12.title: Raju Srivastava's untimely demise makes me very sad: Ajay Devgn
12.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and mourned the demise of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away aged 58. "In your lifetime, you gifted us laughs and more laughs, on and off the screen. Your untimely demise makes me very sad," Ajay tweeted. Director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "There is no such friend or stranger whom Raju didn't make laugh."

13.title: Sonali Phogat had asked for drugs: Aid & murder-accused Sudhir Sangwan
13.article_body: In his confession to the Goa Police, Sonali Phogat's aid and murder accused Sudhir Sangwan said he, along with Sonali and their friend Sukhwinder Singh, "wanted to get high using MDMA drugs" in Goa. He added that after taking MDMA, Phogat's health deteriorated due to an overdose. She vomited, and "her feet were staggering due to intoxication", he added.

14.title: Over 500 property damage cases filed during anti-CAA protests: Delhi Police
14.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday informed the High Court that over 500 cases of property damage were registered during the agitation against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in 2019 and 2020. The police said retired judge Sunil Gaur was appointed the 'claim commissioner' in the related investigations. The court was hearing a petition which sought recovery of the damages.

15.title: Woman straps gold worth ₹15 lakh in sanitary pad, held at B'luru airport
15.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, who was travelling from Thailand to Bengaluru, was held at the Kempegowda International Airport for trying to smuggle gold worth ₹15.4 lakh by strapping it to the sanitary pad she was wearing. The woman was frisked by authorities when she failed to answer a question, following which the gold was found.

16.title: Rats attack road accident victim's dead body kept in mortuary in UP
16.article_body: The body of 21-year-old road accident victim Sumit Gaud, kept in a district hospital mortuary in UP's Gorakhpur, was attacked by rats on Tuesday night. Gaud's family claimed they received his body, which was kept at the mortuary overnight for postmortem, with rat bite marks, including those on his face. Gaud's body was kept in the open, the family claimed.

17.title: Comedian Rohan Joshi criticised for saying 'Good riddance' after Raju Srivastava's death
17.article_body: Comedian Rohan Joshi faced criticism after his remarks on Raju Srivastava's demise. Saying that Srivastava "took every opportunity he ever got to sh*t on newer comics", Joshi wrote in a now-deleted Instagram comment, "Good riddance." "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all," a person commented, while another comment read, "Shame on the pathetic lowlife."

18.title: Idiot and liar: Musk to US professor who claimed his family owned emerald mine
18.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Wednesday called a US professor an "idiot and liar" after he tweeted, "Elon Musk came from a family that owned an emerald mine in Apartheid South Africa." The professor, Robert Reich, also tweeted, "Bill Gates' mom helped Microsoft get a deal with IBM." Through his tweet, Reich called "self-made billionaires" a "myth".

19.title: 'PayCm' posters accusing Bommai of corruption seen across Bengaluru
19.article_body: Posters accusing Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai of corruption were seen pasted across Bengaluru on Wednesday. Titled 'PayCm', the posters featured QR codes which resembled the face of CM Bommai and they bore the tag line 'Scan this QR Code to make the CM PAY for corruption'. Upon scanning, the code redirected to a website called '40% Sarkara'.

20.title: Violation of integrity in its deepest form: Wipro's Premji on staff working for rivals
20.article_body: Rishad Premji, Chairman of IT major Wipro which fired 300 people working directly for one of its competitors, called moonlighting a "complete violation of integrity in its deepest form". He reiterated that there's no space in the company for an employee who also wants to work for a competitor. "I will stand by what I said," Premji said on moonlighting.

21.title: Sanitation workers in B'luru become 'permanent govt employees'
21.article_body: The Karnataka government has decided to give permanent employment status to civic workers in the local bodies, including those under the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. As many as 11,133 civic workers will be treated as government workers and will get the benefits of public servants. However, the workers' association wants permanent status for all 33,000 sanitation workers across the state.

22.title: Man stabs woman colleague in Thane after she refuses to marry him
22.article_body: A man, Yogesh Kumar, allegedly stabbed a woman colleague in Thane after she refused to marry him, police said on Wednesday. Kumar is absconding, while the 27-year-old woman is undergoing treatment, an official said. The woman, who is already married, suffered injuries in stomach and on the face. She managed to hail an auto-rickshaw and reached a hospital, police added.

23.title: Muslim men accuse MP jail official of forcing them to shave beard
23.article_body: Five Muslim men, lodged in a jail in MP's Rajgarh, have alleged that a jail officer forced them to shave their beards, following which a probe was ordered into the matter. A Congress MLA alleged that these men were abused in the jail, while AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi claimed it was an act of "custodial torture".

24.title: 'Appeasement' politics: Patra on Rahul's pic with hijab-clad girl
24.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Tuesday posted a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi walking hand-in-hand with a hijab-clad girl during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, accusing him of appeasement politics. "When votes are accounted for on the basis of religion…then it's called appeasement," Patra said. Reacting to this, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said he "didn't even spare the young girl".

25.title: Fintechs need to comply with regulations earlier: Axis Bank CEO
25.article_body: Axis Bank Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director Amitabh Chaudhry said that fintechs have a tendency to do what they want and hope that the regulators won't notice. He stated that has to change and fintechs have to comply with regulations much earlier than they are currently. Further, Chaudhry said that businesses would suffer if they do not pay heed.

26.title: IIT alumni's synthetic speech tech startup Murf AI raises $10 mn
26.article_body: Murf AI, a synthetic speech technology startup, has raised $10 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Matrix Partners India and saw participation from existing investors such as Elevation Capital along with prominent angel investors. Murf was founded in October 2020 by IIT Kharagpur graduates Sneha Roy, Ankur Edkie and Divyanshu Pandey.

27.title: Was judged for attending event after 2 months of giving birth: Neha Dhupia
27.article_body: Neha Dhupia said, as a new mother, she had faced judgements for things as simple as attending an event two months after giving birth. However, she said she has always ignored the judgements and stayed "very unaffected by them". She added that while being a mother is "the most important role" of her life, she goes to work for herself.

28.title: Was praying to see him come out of this: Raju Srivastava's wife
28.article_body: Late comedian Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha Srivastava said she was hopeful about her husband's recovery. She called Raju Srivastava a "true fighter" as he struggled for his life for almost one and a half months. "He fought very hard, I was really hoping and praying to see him come out of this. But, that has not happened," she said.

29.title: 345 kg of heroin worth ₹1,725 cr seized by Delhi Police in Mumbai
29.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Wednesday made one of the biggest seizures of heroin from Mumbai and seized heroin worth ₹1,725 crore in the international market, a senior official said. "This seizure indicates how narco terror is impacting our country and international players are using different methodologies to push drugs into our country," said Special CP HGS Dhaliwal.

30.title: Pregnant woman suffers miscarriage after rape by 3 men in Bareilly
30.article_body: A woman suffered a miscarriage after allegedly being raped in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said on Wednesday. According to her husband's complaint, the woman, who was three months pregnant, was working on a farm when three men raped her. Police said that the victim has been hospitalised and her condition is critical. One of the accused has been arrested.

31.title: SpiceJet to continue operations at 50% capacity till Oct 29: DGCA
31.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Wednesday extended restrictions placed on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29. DGCA noted that the restrictions have been extended "as a matter of abundant caution". Operating capacity shall be increased if SpiceJet showcases it has "sufficient technical support and financial resource to safely" undertake enhanced capacity, DGCA said.

32.title: I lost a friend of 30 years: Ravi Kishan on Raju Srivastava's death
32.article_body: Speaking about Raju Srivastava's death, actor Ravi Kishan said he lost a friend of 30 years. "We both struggled together and we were able to achieve what we had set to achieve," he stated. Ravi revealed that he shared a stage with the late comedian two months ago. Ravi said Raju laid the foundation of Hindi stand-up comedy in India.

33.title: Jignesh Mevani, 14 Congress MLAs suspended from Gujarat Assembly
33.article_body: Gujarat Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya on Wednesday suspended Independent MLA Jignesh Mevani and 14 Congress MLAs for a day from the Assembly for unruly behaviour. The legislators demanded a discussion on the issues concerning agitating government employees and farmers. However, when the Speaker refused their demand, the legislators rushed near the well of the House and started shouting slogans.

34.title: ADB cuts India's growth forecast to 7% for FY23
34.article_body: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has slashed the GDP growth forecast for India to 7% for the current financial year. This is now slightly lower than the Reserve Bank of India's estimate of 7.2%. ADB said that inflated prices of commodities, oil and inflation will lead to continuing monetary policy tightening, which would hurt growth in the short run.

35.title: Juul Labs sues US FDA over documents related to e-cigarettes ban
35.article_body: Juul Labs has sued the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) after the latter refused to disclose documents supporting its order banning the sale of e-cigarettes in US on June 23. Juul said, "The public deserves a complete picture of the scientific facts behind one of the agency's most controversial and closely scrutinised decisions in recent years" of banning sales.

36.title: Zepto's 19-yr-old Co-founder youngest Indian with ₹1,000 cr personal wealth
36.article_body: Grocery delivery startup Zepto's 19-year-old Co-founder Kaivalya Vohra is the youngest Indian to have a personal wealth of at least ₹1,000 crore, according to Hurun India Rich List 2022. A majority of Vohra's wealth comes from an over 50% rise in the valuation of Zepto, which he founded with 20-year-old Aadit Palicha. Both Vohra and Palicha are Stanford University dropouts.

37.title: Loan apps on Google Play Store to display link to partner banks: Report
37.article_body: Google has reportedly asked loan disbursal apps on Play Store to mandatorily display a link to their partner banks or non-banking finance companies. Google updated its policies on loan apps on September 5, and the deadline for compliance was September 19. The tech giant said it will begin removing apps "that remain non-compliant with the requirements past the deadline provided".

38.title: Lightman, aide held for stealing equipment worth ₹21 lakh in Mumbai
38.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old lighting technician, Shubham Prajapati, and his 24-year-old associate Nikhil Pawar, for stealing lighting equipment worth ₹21 lakh. According to the complaint, the accused were a part of a unit that was shooting a serial at the Mohammad Ali compound in Malvani, Malad and allegedly fled with a light and stand on May 26.

39.title: NIA court sends 4 suspected PFI members to 14-day custody in Hyd
39.article_body: The four people arrested on Monday by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) with alleged links to the Popular Front of India (PFI) were sent to 14-day judicial custody by a Nampally special court in Hyderabad. The NIA conducted multiple searches at 38 locations and seized cash, mobile phones and laptops. The accused were served notices under section 41 of CrPC.

40.title: 2 Naxals, including a woman, carrying reward of ₹6 lakh surrender in Maha
40.article_body:
Two Naxals, including a woman, carrying a collective reward of ₹6 lakh on their heads surrendered before the police in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, a senior official said. The Naxals were identified as 26-year-old Anil alias Ramsay Kujur and 30-year-old Roshani Pallo, police said in a release.
Gadchiroli SP Ankit Goyal stated that 51 Naxals have surrendered since 2019.

41.title: Morgan Stanley to pay $35 million in fine to SEC over data security
41.article_body: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) $35 million for failing to protect consumer data while replacing the company's hard drives and servers. According to the SEC, the bank failed to properly dispose thousands of devices containing consumer data and some were even auctioned online. Morgan Stanley has neither accepted nor denied the allegations.

42.title: Ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari gets 2-year jail for threatening jailer
42.article_body: Former BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari has reportedly been sentenced to two years in prison by the Allahabad High Court for threatening and pointing a gun at a jailor. The case dates back to 2003, when a Lucknow district prison jailer filed an FIR after he was threatened by Ansari for ordering a search of his visitors in jail.

43.title: IIT Madras incubated EV startup Esmito raises ₹10 cr in seed round
43.article_body: Electric vehicle startup Esmito Solutions, incubated by IIT Madras, has secured ₹10 crore in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures. The company was co-founded in 2018 by Prabhjot Kaur, Hasan Ali and Akhila Vijaykumar. In a press release, the startup said that the funds will be used to further strengthen the technology team.

44.title: Stray dogs maul doctor inside Hyd hospital; suffers deep injury, clothes torn
44.article_body: A doctor on duty at a Hyderabad hospital was mauled by a pack of stray dogs inside the hospital, following which she suffered a deep injury to her calf area and her clothes were torn. "There were no security guards available. Similar incidents have happened in the past too. So many complaints have gone in vain," a doctor said.

45.title: Hackers accessed some customer & employee data: American Airlines
45.article_body: American Airlines has said that an "unauthorised actor" accessed personal information of a small number of customers and employees through a phishing campaign. In a consumer notification letter, the carrier notified that the hacker may have obtained details like address and passport number. The airline engaged a cybersecurity forensic firm to investigate after the breach was discovered in July.

46.title: 2 arrested by ACB officials in Hyderabad for demanding ₹30,000 bribe
46.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested two persons, a town planning supervisor and a private architect, for demanding a bribe of ₹30,000 in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The accused were identified as Akula Ashok and A Srinivas Rao. According to the complainant Devender Reddy, he had applied for permission to construct a house and the accused demanded a bribe of ₹30,000.

47.title: Sanskrit teachers in Uttar Pradesh to be trained for online teaching
47.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government will train Sanskrit teachers from government schools in the state for online teaching. The District Inspector of Schools (DIOS) of all 75 districts in the state have been asked to nominate 100 Sanskrit teachers for the training. The teachers will be given a five-day training by experts of Uttar Pradesh Sanskrit Sansthan, an official said.

48.title: Wipro fires 300 employees found 'Moonlighting' for competitors
48.article_body: Wipro terminated the services of 300 employees who were found to be working for its competitors at the same time, said Chairman Rishad Premji. Premji added, "If you actually look at the definition of 'Moonlighting', it is having a second job secretively…I'm all about transparency." He also termed 'Moonlighting' an "act of integrity violation".

49.title: US FTC asks for more details on Amazon, vacuum maker iRobot deal
49.article_body: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has asked Amazon and iRobot Corporation for more details on the former's $1.7-billion buyout of the Roomba vacuum maker. This development comes amid pro-privacy groups citing concerns about privacy and Amazon's already dominant smart home devices market position. In August, Amazon signed a deal to acquire iRobot for $61 apiece in an all-cash transaction.

50.title: Part of Sumanahalli Flyover in Bengaluru caves in
50.article_body: A part of the Sumanahalli Flyover in Bengaluru has caved in. This is the second time since 2019 that such an incident has occurred on the flyover which connects Tumakuru Road to Mysuru Road. Traffic police inspected the spot on Tuesday and barricaded it. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is expected to take up repair work on Thursday.

51.title: PhyicsWallah's Co-founders, Zepto's 19-yr-old Co-founder debut on Hurun India Rich List
51.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah's Co-founders Alakh Pandey and Prateek Maheshwari have made their debut on the IIFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List 2022. Zepto Co-founder Kaivalya Vohra,19, is the youngest to debut on Hurun rich list. For the first time, 100 startup founders with a cumulative wealth of ₹5,06,000 crore and an average age of 40 have featured on the list.

52.title: 'If you don't know the whole story, shut up' posts Raj Kundra 1 year after being freed
52.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra, who was released on bail one year ago in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps, posted a selfie wearing a hoodie and mask with the words "If you don't know the whole story...shut up!!!' written on the picture. He wrote, "Its a matter of time justice will be served!"

53.title: TN BJP leader arrested over threatening remarks against DMK's A Raja
53.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore district BJP president, Balaji Uthamaramasamy, has been arrested for allegedly making threatening remarks against senior DMK leader and Nilgiris MP A Raja. Uthamaramasamy, in a video, purportedly said that if Raja does not stop making derogatory remarks against Hindus, he would not be allowed to set foot at Coimbatore airport.

54.title: 5 arrested for online gambling in Goa
54.article_body: Five people have been arrested for allegedly being involved in online gambling activities in Goa, said police on Wednesday. The accused, all residents of Chhattisgarh, were conducting online gambling activities at Annette Beach Apartments using their laptops and mobile phones, added police. Items worth ₹1.2 lakh have been seized by the police.

55.title: Won't lift wet garbage from big housing societies from October 2: PCMC
55.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has identified 700 big housing societies that generate more than 100 kg of waste per day and said it would not lift wet waste from these societies from October 2. The corporation said it had asked the societies to segregate wet and dry waste and convert wet waste into compost within their premises several times.

56.title: 2 residents of Mumbai housing society win parking space after 20 yrs
56.article_body: Two residents have won parking space after a battle of over 20 years with their housing society in Mumbai's Kandivali. The plaintiffs claimed they had been kept on the waiting list to receive parking space after paying ₹30,000. However, the society didn't give them preference over newcomers. A court has directed it to pay ₹20,000 for mental agony and harassment.

57.title: Girl dies after school bus hits, brushes past her abdomen in Mumbai
57.article_body: A nine-year-old girl died after being hit by a speeding school bus in Mumbai. According to the FIR, the front wheel of the bus brushed past her abdomen. Police said the girl refused treatment after the accident, insisting that she just wanted to go back home to her mother. However, two days later, she complained of abdominal pain and collapsed.

58.title: Hijab restricted only in classrooms; not on campus, school transport: K'taka AG to SC
58.article_body: Hijab is only restricted in classrooms, Karnataka Advocate General (AG) Prabhuling Navadgi told the Supreme Court. "We haven't prohibited it outside...no restriction on school transport or on campus," he added. "Today hijab, tomorrow someone can come wearing 'gamcha'. We can't sustain this in secular institutions like schools," Additional Solicitor General KM Nataraj, representing Karnataka, said.

59.title: 101 cattle dead due to lumpy skin disease in Madhya Pradesh so far
59.article_body: About 101 cattle died due to lumpy skin disease in Madhya Pradesh so far, according to data released by Chief Minister's office. A total of 7,686 animals were affected across 26 districts, out of which 5,432 animals were cured, data showed. "Just like we fought...COVID-19, we'll fight this lumpy virus to save...lives of animals," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said.

60.title: Staging of comedy got new identity because of Raju Srivastava: President
60.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday mourned the loss of comedian Raju Srivastava, saying that his untimely demise is extremely sad. "He had an uncanny talent to enthral the audience with his comical performances," President Murmu tweeted. "Due to his influence, the staging of comedy in India got a new identity. My condolences to his family and fans," she added.

61.title: Imperialism plain and simple: German Chancellor at UNGA on Russia's war
61.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz criticised Russian invasion of Ukraine at the United Nations General Assembly, calling it "imperialism". "We must not stand...by when a major nuclear power, armed to the teeth...seeks to shift borders through the use of violence," he added. Scholz said Russian President Vladimir Putin risks destroying not only Ukraine but also his own country with the war.

62.title: What magic did you do on Mamata?: Gehlot to Vice President Dhankhar
62.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asked Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar what ''magic'' did he do on ''tough lady'' like Mamata Banerjee that she abstained from voting during the Vice President election held in August. Dhankhar, who was addressing Rajasthan Assembly, replied that he asked Mamata to keep her hand on heart and think if he had done anything against the Constitution.

63.title: 'Havan' performed outside Jodhpur DC office over cattle deaths
63.article_body: Several protesters gathered outside the office of the District Collectorate in Rajasthan's Jodhpur to perform a 'havan' over the death of thousands of cattle due to lumpy skin disease. The protesters demanded a compensation of ₹50,000 for their dead cattle from the government. They also sought adequate treatment for the cows affected by the disease.

64.title: Willing to make efforts for peaceful reunification with Taiwan: China
64.article_body: China is willing to make the greatest efforts to achieve peaceful reunification with Taiwan, Ma Xiaoguang, spokesperson for China's Taiwan Affairs Office said. China considers democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and threatens to use force to bring the island nation under its control. In August, China launched military drills near Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit.

65.title: Pic of Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's wedding invite goes viral
65.article_body: Actors Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are set to tie the knot in October. The couple released their wedding invite which has a pop art design featuring sketches of Richa and Ali. The invite looks like a matchbox and the text printed on it reads 'Couple Matches'. They will reportedly have wedding celebrations and functions in Delhi and Mumbai.

66.title: Qualcomm-backed drone maker IdeaForge considers $125 mn IPO: Report
66.article_body: Qualcomm-backed drone maker IdeaForge Technology is reportedly considering raising about $125 million through an initial public offering. It is looking at a valuation of about $700 million in the share sale, which could mostly comprise new shares. The firm was founded in 2007 by IIT-Bombay alumni and is a licensed manufacturer of unmanned aerial vehicles approved by the Defence Ministry.

67.title: Man carrying fake currency worth ₹3.16 lakh arrested in Hyderabad
67.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested one person, Kasthuri Ramesh Babu, for allegedly carrying fake currency notes worth ₹3.16 lakh, police said. Police seized 2,500 fake notes of ₹100 denomination, 45 half-printed fake notes of ₹100 denomination and 92 half-printed fake notes of ₹500 denomination. Police also seized a laptop, two printers, one paper cutting machine, one mobile phone and a four-wheeler.

68.title: Auto-rickshaw driver rapes woman selling cigarettes in Thane; arrested
68.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman vendor near Bhayandar railway station in Thane. The incident took place on September 17, when the woman was selling cigarettes near a rickshaw stand. The 28-year-old accused offered to buy all her stock, took her to an isolated place and raped her inside the auto-rickshaw, police said.

69.title: Tata to bring AirAsia India, Vistara under Air India brand by 2024: Report
69.article_body: Tata Group is planning to merge AirAsia India with Air India Express and Vistara with Air India by 2024, The Indian Express reported. Tata Group, which owns an 83.67% stake in AirAsia India and a 51% stake in Vistara, is planning to purchase AirAsia India's remaining stake for $30 million. AirAsia India's merger will likely take 12 months to complete.

70.title: Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari mocks Pandya over 'We'll learn' post, gets trolled
70.article_body: Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari mocked Hardik Pandya over his 'We'll learn' post on Twitter after Australia's victory against India in the first T20I. "Please lose next match to Pakistan on 23rd October...you'll learn more from it," Sehar wrote. Trolling her, an Indian fan wrote, "Have some shame...you lost to England at home." "Are you familiar with...term 'Udta teer'?" wrote another.

71.title: Raju Srivastava provided the divine gift of laughter to many: Kumar Vishvas
71.article_body: Poet Dr Kumar Vishvas expressed his grief on the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava. Vishvas called Srivastava as someone who "provided the divine gift of laughter" to many people. Actor Rajpal Yadav and comedienne Bharti Singh also mourned Srivastava's demise. Yadav tweeted, "You'll be missed my brother", while Singh said the news is "unbelievable and heartbreaking".

72.title: Amanatullah Khan discharged from AIIMS, to appear before court today
72.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Amanatullah Khan has been discharged from Delhi's AIIMS, where he was admitted on Tuesday after complaining about chest pain. Khan is currently in the custody of Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Bureau. He will be produced before the Rouse Avenue Court at 4 pm today (Wednesday) in connection with illegal recruitments in the Delhi Waqf Board.

73.title: Grandfather, uncle sexually assault 20-yr-old woman, booked by Mumbai Police
73.article_body: The Mumbai Police have booked the grandfather and an uncle of a 20-year-old woman for allegedly sexually assaulting her. The police arrested her 52-year-old grandfather on Sunday and sent a team to UP to trace the uncle, after learning that he had been raping the woman for 12 years. Her uncle told her to not inform anyone, an officer said.

74.title: Swaraj Engines hits 52-week high after becoming M&M subsidiary
74.article_body: Shares of diesel engine manufacturer Swaraj Engines Limited surged the most since June 2020 gaining 13% to ₹1,919 after it became Mahindra & Mahindra's subsidiary company. Its stock hit a 52-week high in intraday trading. Mahindra & Mahindra announced that it would acquire 17.4% equity of the Kirloskar Industries-owned Swaraj Engines for a total cash consideration of ₹296 crore.

75.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava's funeral to be held on Thursday in Delhi
75.article_body: Late comedian Raju Srivastava's funeral will be held at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi on Thursday, his family confirmed. Srivastava passed away at the age of 58. He was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi on August 10 after he suffered a heart attack and collapsed while working out in the gym. He had undergone angioplasty and was put on a ventilator.

76.title: Gautam Adani made over ₹1,600 crore per day over the last year: Hurun
76.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani made over ₹1,600 crore per day on average, over the last year, according to Hurun India Rich List 2022 released on Wednesday. The 60-year-old business tycoon has topped the list with a wealth of ₹10,94,400 crore. Adani is ahead of Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani by ₹3 lakh crore in terms of estimated wealth.

77.title: BJP calls T'gana CM 'Kasim Chandrashekar Rizvi' over closeness with AIMIM
77.article_body: Telangana BJP President Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Tuesday compared Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao with Razakars militia founder Kasim Rizvi and called him 'Kasim Chandrashekar Rizvi' over his closeness with AIMIM. "We'll fight CM KCR...We're sons and force of saffron...But if you target my Hindu Dharma Rakshaks and Gau Rakshaks, we won't leave you," Kumar said.

78.title: Putin's threats to West must be taken very seriously: UK
78.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's threat to the West that he has lots of weapons is "chilling" and must be taken "very seriously", UK Foreign Office minister Gillian Keegan said. Putin on Wednesday ordered Russia's first military mobilisation since World War II, warning that Moscow would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if West continues its "nuclear blackmail".

79.title: Not confirming it yet: Ayan on Deepika being part of Brahmastra's sequel
79.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji said people have "imagined" Deepika Padukone as Amrita. His reaction came after fans claimed that a viral photo featured Deepika holding baby Shiva in her arms. "What you want to see is what you see. We're not confirming that Deepika is a part of part one or part two yet," Ayan said.

80.title: Raju Srivastava made the country laugh, sad that he's gone: Sunil Grover
80.article_body: Comedian-actor Sunil Grover mourned comedian Raju Srivastava's death. "He made the whole country laugh. It's sad today that he has gone, too soon," Grover wrote on Instagram. Ajay Devgn thanked Srivastava for gifting the audience with laughter and wrote, "Your untimely demise makes me very sad." Vicky Kaushal, Varun Dhawan, Malaika Arora and many others also paid their condolences.

81.title: BJP stages protest demanding CBI probe into 5-yr-old boy's death in WB
81.article_body: The BJP on Wednesday staged a protest outside the West Bengal Assembly against the TMC-led government over the death of a five-year-old boy in Birbhum. "We demand...CBI inquiry. A BJP delegation will meet...family of the deceased," Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari said. The boy reportedly went missing on Sunday and was found dead in his neighbour's house on Tuesday evening.

82.title: Mrunal Thakur stood out the most, truly a queen: Kangana on 'Sita Ramam'
82.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut called 'Sita Ramam' a "spectacular experience" and said Mrunal Thakur "stood out the most" for her. "Restrained emotions and rare dignity in her demeanour, no other actress could have portrayed...truly a queen," Kangana wrote, adding, "Thakur saab, here begins your reign." 'Sita Ramam', also starring Dulquer Salmaan, is directed by Hanu Raghavapudi.

83.title: Activist, who raised voice against PDS corruption, dies by suicide in K'taka
83.article_body: Activist Veerachari, who had filed complaints against corruption by Public Distribution System (PDS) contractor Siddaramappa, allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka's Davanagere on Tuesday. He had met the Deputy Commissioner (DC) on Monday to complain about Siddaramappa facing no action. "He ended his life over this fight and...we want action against the shop owner," Veerachari's daughter said.

84.title: Not our delivery partner: Zomato after delivery agent molests Pune woman
84.article_body: Online food delivery platform Zomato has issued a statement after a food delivery agent molested a 19-year-old woman in Pune. In its statement, Zomato said the accused is not its delivery partner, adding that it conducts third-party background verifications while onboarding any person to its fleet. The 40-year-old man allegedly kissed the woman twice after finding her alone at home.

85.title: Being Shah Rukh Khan's wife works against me 50% of the time: Gauri
85.article_body: Gauri Khan, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', said some people consider her a designer when considering a new project. However, she added it doesn't work this way sometimes. "Sometimes people do not want to get attached to the baggage of working with Shah Rukh Khan's wife. It works against me 50% of the time," she added.

86.title: Filing cases, arresting Oppn leaders seem to be Centre's flagship project: Pawar
86.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said filing cases and arresting Opposition leaders seem to be the "flagship project" of the Centre. "If you check today's newspaper, it has detailed how central probe agencies have increased their actions against the Opposition parties and leaders," Pawar added. "The key issues and challenges before the society are kept aside," he stated.

87.title: Mumbai man captures Indian monitor lizard for meat & oil, arrested
87.article_body: A man was arrested near Mumbai's Aksa Beach for capturing an Indian monitor lizard for its meat and oil. The reptile was found dead by the police. The investigating officer said the crime was driven by the belief that the reptile's oil brings relief to people suffering from knee and joint problems. The accused is a resident of Malad.

88.title: 230 pilot whales stranded on Tasmania's west coast, half presumed dead
88.article_body: About 230 whales have been stranded on Ocean Beach on Tasmania's west coast. According to the Department of Natural Resources and Environment Tasmania, the pod appears to be pilot whales and at least half are presumed to be alive. On Monday, 14 dead sperm whales were discovered on King Island in the Bass Strait between Melbourne and Tasmania's northern coast.

89.title: Cong MLA Deepika Pandey takes bath on waterlogged road in J'khand to demand its repair
89.article_body: Congress MLA Deepika Pandey Singh sat on a dharna on waterlogged NH-133 which passes through Jharkhand to protest the poor road quality and demand its repair. While protesting, she took bath on the road in a symbolic gesture. The road has been in a bad condition for a long time and accidents happen on the road every day, she said.

90.title: Delhi govt to issue pension cards for senior citizens, differently-abled
90.article_body: The Delhi government will issue pension cards for senior citizens and differently-abled persons to make the process of pension disbursement easier, Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam said. "It's our duty to ensure...they're given a pension in...timely manner," he said. Delhi government provides a monthly pension of ₹2,500 to 4.5 lakh elderly people and 1.14 lakh differently able persons.

91.title: Man kills female friend with axe over suspicion of affair in Ghaziabad
91.article_body: A 25-year-old allegedly murdered his 33-year-old female friend over suspicion of an affair in Ghaziabad. The incident occurred on September 16 at her flat in the Deen Dayal Puri area. According to police, the accused assaulted the woman several times, including on the head, with an axe, and later fled away from the scene. Police on Tuesday arrested the accused.

92.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts tomorrow
92.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has announced some scheduled power shutdowns in parts of the city tomorrow (September 22) as Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation (KPTCL) will carry out maintenance works in the city. Power outages will occur between 10 am and 4 pm. The BESCOM divisions which will be affected tomorrow are - Kanakapura, Kengeri, Davanagere and Hiriyuru.

93.title: Flowers left in tribute to Queen Elizabeth to be composted, reused in parks
93.article_body: Flowers left in tribute in London's parks for Queen Elizabeth II will be composted and reused on planting projects, the city's Royal Parks said. The compost will be used on landscaping projects and shrubberies across the parks, it added. Work to remove the bunches of flowers will begin next Monday, a week after the state funeral for the late sovereign.

94.title: Will miss you 'Gajodhar Bhaiya': Mann on Laughter Challenge co-contestant Raju's death
94.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann mourned the demise of his 'The Great Indian Laughter Challenge' co-contestant Raju Srivastava. "He made us laugh a lot...but today it's very sad to hear this news...Worked a lot with him and got to learn a lot," tweeted Mann. "We'll miss you 'Gajodhar Bhaiya'," he added while referring to the character developed by Srivastava.

95.title: Leopard carcass found in field in UP's Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary
95.article_body: A female leopard's carcass was recovered from an agricultural field in Uttar Pradesh's Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary on Tuesday morning. According to the post-mortem report, it's suspected that the incident occurred following a conflict between two leopards. While the deceased leopard is estimated to be around one-and-a-half years, the second leopard is likely to be older, the report stated.

96.title: Raju Srivastava suffered another cardiac arrest in morning: Late comedian's nephew
96.article_body: According to comedian Raju Srivastava's nephew Kushal, he suffered another cardiac arrest on Wednesday morning, which he could not survive. Srivastava passed away at the age of 58. He was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi after suffering a heart attack and collapsing while working out in a gym on August 10.

97.title: Assam govt may regulate private madrassas: Education minister
97.article_body: Assam government may regulate all the private madrassas under an existing Act, the state Education Minister Ranoj Pegu said. "The government is considering if private seminaries can be brought under the control of the Assam Non-Government Educational Institutions (Regulation and Management) Act, 2006," he added. "All non-governmental schools are not covered under this Act," Pegu stated.

98.title: Man beaten up with sticks by daughter-in-law's family in Gurugram, dies
98.article_body: A 55-year-old man died after being beaten up with sticks by his daughter-in-law's family members in Gurugram, police said on Tuesday. The deceased man's wife alleged that the accused also beat her up when she tried to save her husband. Reportedly, their daughter-in-law had a tussle with their son and, therefore, she went to her maternal home four days ago.

99.title: Who are the 10 richest Indians and what are their wealths according to Hurun?
99.article_body: Gautam Adani & family have topped the Hurun India Rich List 2022 with a wealth of ₹10,94,400 crore. They're followed by Mukesh Ambani & family with a wealth of ₹7,94,700 crore. Cyrus S Poonawalla & family rank third, followed by the families of HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar, DMart's Radhakishan Damani, Gautam Adani's brother Vinod Shantilal Adani, and SP Hinduja.

100.title: He was supposed to be removed from ventilator in 2-3 days: Raju Srivastava's family
100.article_body: Late Raju Srivastava's brother-in-law told IndiaToday.in that the comedian was supposed to be removed from the ventilator in two or three days, adding that his medicine doses had been decreased. He said, "In the morning, his BP dropped and then he was given CPR. At first, he responded to it but later collapsed." Srivastava's funeral will be held in Delhi.

101.title: Won't say no if people in Cong think I'm needed in role of party chief: Gehlot
101.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said, "If people in the party think I'm needed in the role of party President or CM, then I won't say no." Furthermore, he said, "I'll again request Rahul Gandhi. If he conducts 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as party President, then it'll create an aura for the party."

102.title: Be proactive, need to bring transparency in system: Nadda to Guj party workers
102.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday asked party workers and elected representatives in Gujarat to "be proactive, pro responsible and pro responsive". "We'll have to bring transparency in system and deliver in transparent manner…this will keep people's faith alive in us," Nadda said while addressing elected representatives from gram to district panchayats, municipal corporations and others.

103.title: Manipur Cabinet approves lifting prohibition partially
103.article_body: To boost the state's revenue, the Manipur Cabinet has decided to partially lift the ban on brewing, consumption and sale of liquor. Prohibition will be lifted from all district headquarters, including Imphal city, tourist destinations and hotels with at least 20 beds, said the state's Tribal Affairs Minister Letpao Haokip. The government is also mulling to export traditionally brewed liquor.

104.title: Public representatives have become a 'laughing stock': VP Dhankhar
104.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday expressed concern over "inappropriate conduct" of public representatives inside Parliament and state Assemblies, adding that they have become a "laughing stock" in front of the public. "Those who should discuss Parliament and Assembly have come on roads," Dhankhar said. "Time has come for a widespread contemplation on this serious situation," he added.

105.title: Massive traffic jam on NH-48 from Kherki toll to G'gram's Hero Honda Chowk
105.article_body: A huge traffic jam was reported on NH-48 from Kherki toll to Hero Honda Chowk towards Delhi on Wednesday morning due to the closure of Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway. A five-kilometre-long queue of vehicles was reportedly seen from the junction to the Cloverleaf flyover. The carriageway will remain shut till September 26.

106.title: 40-yr-old teacher, 17-yr-old girl student found hanging in forest in UP
106.article_body: A 40-year-old school teacher and his 17-year-old girl student were found hanging in the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur on Tuesday, police said. The teacher was having an affair with the girl who studied in the same school where he worked, police added. The state of the bodies suggests that both had committed suicide about ten days ago, police stated.

107.title: Activist breaks down at UNGA after appealing for education for Afghan girls
107.article_body: Afghan activist Somaya Faruqi broke down backstage after urging leaders at the United Nations to protect girls' education and women's rights in Afghanistan. On Sunday, the UN urged the Taliban to reopen high schools for Afghan girls that have been shut for a year. The Taliban have barred women from leaving homes without a male relative and a face cover.

108.title: Majority of states want Rahul to be Congress President: Sachin Pilot
108.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that majority of states want Rahul Gandhi to be Congress President. "Whether he will contest or not, that's his decision, but one thing is for sure, party will get a new President on October 17th," he added. His statement comes after reports claimed that Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot might contest for Congress chief post.

109.title: Ratan Tata nominated as trustee of PM CARES Fund
109.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, former Supreme Court judge KT Thomas and former Deputy Lok Sabha Speaker Kariya Munda have been nominated as trustees of the PM CARES Fund, the government said. The announcement came a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired the board of trustees meeting that was attended by Union Ministers Amit Shah and Nirmala Sitharaman.

110.title: Road ministry issues draft rules for mandatory rear seat belt alarms
110.article_body: Union Ministry of Road, Transport and Highways has issued draft rules to make it mandatory for car makers to install an alarm system for rear seat belts. Recently, former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car accident and it was reported that while he was sitting in the rear seat, he didn’t have his seat belt on.

111.title: AIIMS doctor transferred for taking money to perform surgery
111.article_body: A doctor from AIIMS, Delhi has been transferred to the National Cancer Institute in Jhajjar after he was found to have taken money from a patient's father for performing a surgery. According to a fact-finding committee's report, Dr KK Roy allegedly asked for ₹34,000 citing the need to procure supplies. Roy said the accusation is not correct.

112.title: He was and will remain king of comedy: Sunil Pal on Raju Srivastava
112.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal called Raju Srivastava a "brave warrior" who fought till his last breath. "He was, is and will always remain the king of stand-up comedy," Sunil said, adding that his death has left a big void in the entertainment industry. "Raju Srivastava cannot be replaced. His memories will live in our hearts forever," he added.

113.title: US, Canadian warships sail through Taiwan Strait, China condemns action
113.article_body: A US Navy warship and a Canadian frigate made a routine transit through the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, both countries' militaries confirmed. China condemned the mission, saying its forces "warned" the ships. The transit was reportedly the second in a month by a US Navy ship and the second jointly by the US and Canada since October 2021.

114.title: Engineer arrested for attacking cab driver with knife, assaulting policemen
114.article_body: The Pune Police arrested a 27-year-old software engineer for allegedly attacking a cab driver with a knife after he rejected the trip and also for assaulting two policemen who responded to the situation. The accused attacked one of the policemen with wooden rod and pushed the other. The cab driver sustained injury on stomach but is out of danger.

115.title: Over 300 booked for clash during Ganesh Chaturthi procession in K'taka
115.article_body: More than 300 people have been booked for allegedly attacking the Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Ranebennur of Karnataka's Haveri district, police said. The accused attacked the procession with lethal weapons, triggering violence in the area, police added. "No matter what community they belong to, strict action should be taken against them," JD(S) spokesperson Tanveer Ahmed said.

116.title: Goldman Sachs fires at least 25 bankers in Asia: Report
116.article_body: Goldman Sachs has laid off at least 25 bankers in Asia, Bloomberg News reported. The job cuts impacted junior-level bankers involved in deals in Greater China, the report added. In 2021, Goldman Sachs increased hiring in mainland China and Hong Kong after their financial markets opened to foreign brokerages. The bank's headcount increased to 47,000 by June end.

117.title: BYJU'S shifting focus to profitable growth: CEO tells employees
117.article_body: BYJU'S Founder and CEO, Byju Raveendran, told employees that the company has already started shifting focus towards profitable growth and the idea is to allocate resources effectively to maximise impact. Last week, BYJU'S released audited financial statement for FY21 after a delay of nearly 18 months. The ed-tech firm recorded a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, financial results showed.

118.title: Air Force allows PMC to build road on defence land to reach Pune airport
118.article_body: The Air Force has given approval to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for building an alternate road to Vimannagar through their land. According to officials, PMC requires 2,350 square meters of defence land to complete the road connecting Pune airport with Vimannagar. "PMC had...constructed the road from both ends...only the Air Force road portion was pending," Pune MP Girish Bapat said.

119.title: Triveni Turbine's stock jumps 6.6% after reports of block deal
119.article_body: Triveni Turbine Limited's shares traded 6.6% higher at ₹243.5 apiece on Wednesday after reports of multiple block deals involving 70.5 million shares changing hands. Triveni Engineering and Industries Ltd, which holds a 21.85% stake in Triveni Turbine, reportedly launched a block deal to sell a stake of 11.85%. The details of the buyers and sellers are yet to be known.

120.title: Actress Bharti Jaffery, daughter of legendary Ashok Kumar, dies
120.article_body: Actress Bharti Jaffrey, daughter of legendary actor Ashok Kumar, passed away on Tuesday after a prolonged illness. Actor Kanwaljit Singh, who is married to Bharti's daughter Anuradha Patel, shared the news of her demise on social media. Bharti Jaffrey starred in movies such as Hazaar Chaurasi Ki Maa, Saans and Daman. She was married to Saeed Jaffrey's brother, Hamid Jaffrey.

121.title: Air India Express incurs net loss for first time in 7 years due to COVID-19
121.article_body: Air India Express, which mainly operates flights between India and the Gulf countries, reported a net loss for the first time in seven years because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The airline posted a net loss of ₹72.33 crore in FY22, against a net profit of ₹98.21 crore in FY21. In FY15, it had posted a net loss of ₹61 crore.

122.title: Raju Srivastava took genre of comedy to new heights with his talent: UP CM
122.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath expressed his grief over the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava. "Raju Srivastava is no more with us. I, on behalf of the people of UP, pray that his soul rests in peace," CM Yogi said. "Raju Srivastava took the genre of comedy…to new heights with his talent and hard work," he stated.

123.title: Residents oppose building of animal hospital in Pune's Hadapsar
123.article_body: Residents of Pune's Hadapsar opposed PMC's decision to build a hospital for animals in the area. "We too want other infrastructure projects in Hadapsar but we only find garbage processing plants and now this animal hospital," said a former NCP corporator. The hospital should be built in a locality where citizens have greater love for stray dogs, said a resident.

124.title: Vehicular movement to be affected in Kurla, police shares diversion routes
124.article_body: The vehicular movement will be hit in Mumbai's Kurla area due to work related to a sewage line and Metro 2 B construction, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic restrictions will be in place from 12 am on October 1 till 12 am on March 1, 2023. The traffic police shared the list of optional routes for vehicular movement.

125.title: Will use all means to protect Russia if threatened, this is not a bluff: Putin to West
125.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered the country's first mobilisation since WWII, warning that Russia would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if West continues its "nuclear blackmail". Accusing West of plotting to destroy Russia amid the war in Ukraine, Putin said, "If...threatened, we'll use all available means to protect our people - this isn't a bluff."

126.title: There's no particular reason for its failure: Ronit Roy on 'Liger'
126.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy said he personally doesn't think there's any particular reason behind the box office failure of his recent release, 'Liger'. "You cannot pinpoint something like that. You may hear people say one reason which the majority will agree with, but not every single person thinks like that," he said. Ronit played MMA coach in the Puri Jagannadh directorial.

127.title: Central agencies get their script from BJP office: RJD's Manoj Jha
127.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Tuesday extended support to the resolution passed in the West Bengal Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies. These agencies get their script from the BJP office, Jha stated. He said that according to a report in an English daily, 95% of the cases probed by these agencies are of Opposition leaders.

128.title: Man arrested for vandalising police van, manhandling constable in Pune
128.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for allegedly vandalising a police van and manhandling an on-duty police constable in Pune's Bhosari, police said. "The accused initially hurled a stone at the van...constable was inside...he got down...(accused) manhandled the constable and verbally abused him," police added. "We are probing why he suddenly resorted to vandalising the police vehicle," police stated.

129.title: Mumbai sees 120 new COVID-19 cases, nearly double from day before
129.article_body: Mumbai reported 120 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, nearly double the number seen a day before, when it recorded 66 infections, according to BMC. With one new fatality, the overall death toll reached 19,726, while the cumulative case count climbed to 11,49,235 in the city. The number of active cases stood at 936.

130.title: Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, his demise is saddening: PM Modi
130.article_body: After the death of comedian Raju Srivastava, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, humour and positivity." "He leaves us too soon but he will continue to live in hearts of countless people thanks to his rich work over the years. His demise is saddening. Condolences to his family and admirers. Om Shanti," he wrote.

131.title: Central Bank of India stock jumps 15.5% after RBI lifts PCA curb
131.article_body: The shares of Central Bank of India opened 15.5% higher on Wednesday after the Reserve Bank of India removed it from the prompt corrective action (PCA) framework after a period of over five years. The lender was put under the PCA framework in June 2017 because of its high net non-performing assets and low return on assets.

132.title: Constable found dead in Pune CRPF campus, police suspect suicide
132.article_body: A 30-year-old constable of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) was found dead on the CRPF campus in Pune district's Talegaon Dabhade on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the deceased, identified as Amaresh Kumar Giri, hailed from Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. "Primary investigation points to death by suicide. We have launched an investigation," said Inspector Ganesh Jawadwad.

133.title: HK arrests harmonica player at Queen Elizabeth's vigil for sedition
133.article_body: A 43-year-old harmonica player who went to the British consulate in Hong Kong on Monday night to pay tribute to UK Queen Elizabeth II, among scores of mourners, was arrested for alleged sedition. The man reportedly played several songs on his harmonica, including the 'Glory to Hong Kong', the unofficial anthem of pro-democracy protests that rocked the city in 2019.

134.title: Boeing to cut 150 finance jobs in US, may outsource some jobs to India
134.article_body: Planemaker Boeing has said that it will cut 150 finance jobs in the US, with more to come next year and thereafter, in a bid to simplify its corporate structure. The first layoff notices will go out in October. As per a report, the company may outsource some finance and accounting jobs to TCS in India.

135.title: He created his presence in world: Akhilesh on Raju Srivastava's demise
135.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav condoled comedian Raju Srivastava's demise, saying that he created his presence in the world with his talent and hard work. "He came from a poor family…I remember how he wanted to contest from Kanpur when he joined SP," Yadav added. Furthermore, Yadav said that there are very few talented comedians like him.

136.title: Clash between woman, beautician at Delhi salon over eyebrow treatment
136.article_body: Two women were booked by police after a clash erupted between them at a South Delhi salon over "botched-up" eyebrow treatment. The customer, 48, did not like the eyebrow work and an argument broke out between them which escalated into a fight. The customer alleged that she was bitten on her arm while the beautician said her clothes were torn.

137.title: Japanese man sets himself on fire in alleged protest over ex-PM's state funeral
137.article_body: A man, in his 70s, set himself on fire near Japanese Prime Minister's office in an alleged protest against state funeral for former PM Shinzo Abe, reports said. The man reportedly told police he had deliberately doused himself in oil. A letter with words "I strongly oppose it" was found nearby. A police officer trying to extinguish flames was injured.

138.title: Ashutosh Gowariker predicted Chhello Show's Oscars entry: Director Pan Nalin
138.article_body: 'Chhello Show' director Pan Nalin said Ashutosh Gowariker had predicted the film's selection for Oscars five months ago. Remembering Gowariker's reaction after watching the film, Nalin shared, "He said, 'Pack your bags, you guys are going to the Oscars'. This happened five months ago. We laughed then and forgot about it. Aaj yaad aa raha hai (Today I remember it)."

139.title: Samajwadi Party and truth are 2 banks of river, can never meet: CM Yogi
139.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said Samajwadi Party and truth are two banks of a river which can never meet. "It's time [Akhilesh] Yadav learns to speak the truth in the house," CM Yogi added. His remark came as Yadav on Tuesday questioned the health system of UP inside the House on the second day of the Monsoon session.

140.title: Intimacy scenes are not exotic, they're most awkward to shoot: Pooja Bhatt
140.article_body: Pooja Bhatt said Vidya Balan called her after the release of 'Bombay Begums' and expressed how she didn't "cringe" when she saw her kissing on screen. Recalling the compliment, Pooja said that people feel that shooting intimate scenes is "exotic", but she called them the "most awkward thing to shoot". She added, "The challenge is to make it look bearable."

141.title: I want to spend the day with you naked: Singer Adam Levine in message to yoga teacher
141.article_body: After 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine was accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by a model, a yoga teacher has shared a message that he sent her. "I want to spend the day with you naked," he wrote in the message, according to Alanna Zabel. She said that she taught Levine yoga from 2007 to 2010.

142.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal condoles demise of comedian Raju Srivastava
142.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal expressed his grief at the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava on Wednesday. "Very sad to hear [about] the demise of famous comedian Raju Srivastava ji. My condolences to his family and all...fans in this time of sorrow," Kejriwal tweeted. Srivastava was admitted to AIIMS Delhi on August 10 after suffering a heart attack and collapsing.

143.title: Samantha's manager dismisses reports that she went to US over 'rare skin condition'
143.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's manager Mahendra has rubbished the rumours that she travelled to the US to undergo treatment for some 'rare skin condition'. Reports claimed her alleged medical condition was the reason for her refraining from public appearances, however, Samantha's manager said, "It's gossip." He did not explain the nature of Samantha's foreign trip.

144.title: RSS head meets Muslim intellectuals to discuss religious inclusivity
144.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat met with several Muslim intellectuals to discuss ways to strengthen religious inclusivity in the country, reported ANI. Former MP Shahid Siddiqui, who attended the meeting, said, "We are concerned that whatever is happening in the country is weakening the religious unity in the country." "Bhagwat belongs to an institution which is followed by many," he added.

145.title: 4 Ukrainian regions to vote in a referendum this week to join Russia
145.article_body: Russia-controlled regions of Ukraine, which include Luhansk, Kherson, Zaporizhzhia and Donetsk, plan to vote this week to become parts of Russia. Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, said referendums that fold regions into Russia would make redrawn frontiers "irreversible". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba denounced vote, saying referendums will change nothing.

146.title: Deeply saddened by passing away of Raju Srivastava: Rajnath Singh
146.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh mourned the loss of comedian Raju Srivastava. The minister tweeted that he is "deeply saddened" to learn about Srivastava's death and extended his condolences to his family and fans. "Apart from being an accomplished artist, he was also a very lively person," the tweet read. The comedian died at the age of 58 in Delhi today.

147.title: Rahul resumes Bharat Jodo Yatra, pays tributes to Sree Narayana Guru
147.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday resumed Bharat Jodo Yatra from Kerala's Madavana. He was accompanied by several party leaders, including Sachin Pilot. On the 14th day of the 'yatra', the Wayanad MP paid floral tributes to social reformer Sree Narayana Guru. The Congress party shared several images of Gandhi mixing with people during the foot march.

148.title: Even poorest of Indian citizen deserves best quality products: Piyush Goyal
148.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said even the poorest citizen of the country deserves the best quality products and the culture of no compromise with quality has to be adopted in the country. "We need to change this mindset of two quality standards for domestic and international markets and must not compromise with quality," Goyal added.

149.title: Great loss to the world of art: Amit Shah on death of Raju Srivastava
149.article_body: After the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "He had a unique style, he impressed everyone with his amazing talent." "His death is a great loss to the world of art. I express my condolences to his family and fans. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," he wrote.

150.title: Fire breaks out at Andhra's paper plate factory; 3, including owner, killed
150.article_body: At least three persons died as a fire broke out at a paper plate manufacturing factory in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor on Tuesday. The owner of the factory was among the deceased. The other two victims were at the owner's house in the same building to celebrate his son's birthday.  "Investigating is underway...Some of the workers taken to hospital," police said.

151.title: All SC constitution bench hearings to be live-streamed from Sept 27
151.article_body: In a full court meeting on Tuesday, the judges of the Supreme Court unanimously decided to start live-streaming of all constitution bench hearings from September 27. This comes a week after senior advocate Indira Jaising wrote to CJI UU Lalit and other judges requesting live streaming of proceedings of public and constitutional importance.

152.title: Delhi lane of Gurugram's Hero Honda flyover to be closed from Sept 21-26
152.article_body: The Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of the Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway will be closed for traffic from September 21 to 26. During this period, commuters going towards Delhi will have to use the NH-48. According to the Gurugram Traffic Police, the lane is being closed to check the status of repair works carried out on the carriageway.

153.title: BJP MLA booked for harassing woman, son for rape: Agra Police
153.article_body: BJP MLA Chotte Lal Verma has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman and his son for allegedly raping her, Agra Police said. MLA has not been accused of rape, police added. The woman claimed that the MLA's son married her in a temple and forced her to abort three times for want of a male child, police further said.

154.title: SpiceJet stock falls 3% after airline sends 80 pilots on unpaid leave
154.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet traded over 3% lower at ₹41.9 apiece at 9:18 am on the BSE on Wednesday after the airline asked 80 of its pilots to go on a three-month leave without pay as a temporary measure to rationalise cost. The pilots, who have been forced to go on leave, are from the Gurugram-headquartered airline's Boeing and Bombardier fleet.

155.title: RBI approves R Gandhi as part-time Chairman of Yes Bank
155.article_body: The RBI has approved the appointment of its Former Deputy Governor, Rama Subramaniam Gandhi, as Non-Executive (Part-Time) Chairman of Yes Bank for three years, a regulatory filing said. Gandhi had a three-year secondment to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). He is a financial sector policy advisor who worked with investors and fintech companies.

156.title: Pak PM accused of treason for consulting Nawaz Sharif over new Army chief
156.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has been accused of committing treason for consulting his 'fugitive' elder brother and ex-PM Nawaz Sharif on the appointment of the new Army chief. A resolution was passed by the Punjab state assembly in this regard, seeking action against the PM. Shehbaz had met his brother while he was in London for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral.

157.title: Owaisi asks why is Jamia Masjid shut, Srinagar Police says it's not
157.article_body: After AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi asked Jammu & Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha why Srinagar's Jamia Masjid is shut every Friday, the police refuted the claim saying it is fully open. It was closed only on three occasions post-COVID, owing to inputs of terror attack and law and order situation, tweeted Srinagar Police. "Staying far is no excuse of ignorance," it added.

158.title: Yes Bank approves sale of its ₹48,000-crore bad loans to JC Flowers ARC
158.article_body: Yes Bank said its board has approved the transfer of stressed assets worth ₹48,000 crore to JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction after receiving no bids to challenge what was made by the private equity company. While JC Flowers submitted an initial bid of ₹11,183 crore for the NPA, it's said to be the largest sale of stressed assets in domestic markets.

159.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava passes away aged 58
159.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava has passed away in Delhi at the age of 58, his family confirmed. He was admitted to All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in Delhi on August 10 after experiencing chest pain and collapsing while working out at a gym. Srivastava had underwent angioplasty and was put on a ventilator.

160.title: MP minister writes to Anurag Thakur, seeks ban on Ajay Devgn's film 'Thank God'
160.article_body: Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang has written to Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting Anurag Thakur, seeking a ban on Ajay Devgn and Sidharth Malhotra's upcoming film 'Thank God'. Sarang said that the film depicted Hindu gods inappropriately. An official statement from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting is awaited, ANI reported.

161.title: Mumbai sees 62% surge in Malaria cases, dengue cases rise by 16%
161.article_body: Mumbai witnessed a 62% surge in Malaria cases, followed by 16% rise in dengue cases in the last week alone. Between September 12 and 18, Malaria cases increased to 191 as compared to 118 a week ago, whereas dengue cases jumped from 51 to 59 during the same period, a report stated. Experts have urged citizens to refrain from self-medicating.

162.title: Bystanders were taking videos instead of helping: Noida wall collapse eyewitness
162.article_body: An eyewitness to Noida's Sector 21 wall collapse incident, in which four labourers were killed, said that those standing near the drain were busy shooting videos even as they watched a few trying to help workers trapped under the debris. There were 12 people hired to clean and repair the drain when the wall collapsed on them, officials said.

163.title: Shinde is my guru: Pune man arrested for posing as CM
163.article_body: Vijay Nandkumar Mane, the man from Pune who was arrested for posing as Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, expressed regret if his actions caused trouble to the CM. "CM Shinde is my guru and I have great respect for him," said Mane. Dressed up like Shinde, Mane was clicked with a gangster, which led to a controversy.

164.title: Adani Group pledges stake worth $13 bn in newly acquired ACC, Ambuja Cements
164.article_body: Adani Group has pledged shares valued at about $13 billion in Ambuja Cements and ACC, days after it completed its acquisition from Holcim Group. Adani Group’s stakes in the two companies, about 57% in ACC and 63% in Ambuja Cements, have been encumbered "for the benefit of certain lenders and other finance parties," as per stock filings.

165.title: India reports 4,510 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,216
165.article_body: India reported 4,510 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,640 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,216. The death toll has risen to 5,28,403, while daily positivity rate stands at 1.33%, as per data.

166.title: Tata firm TRF's shares surge 100% in 6 days, trade at 6-year high
166.article_body: Tata Group firm TRF Limited's shares surged over 100% in six consecutive sessions on Tuesday amid higher volumes with the stock hitting over six-year highs of ₹340.55 apiece on the NSE. CARE Ratings also revised TRF's long-term outlook rating from 'negative' to 'stable' after its promoter Tata Steel invested ₹165 crore in the company in June for working capital requirements.

167.title: Beyond Meat suspends COO after arrest in nose biting incident
167.article_body: Beyond Meat has suspended its COO Doug Ramsey effective immediately after reports of his arrest for allegedly biting a man's nose during a quarrel. Senior Vice President of manufacturing operations, Jon Nelson, will be overseeing the operations activities on an interim basis. Ramsey was detained on Saturday on third-degree battery and threatening charges, court records showed.

168.title: Tried over 50 looks for my character: Trisha on 'Ponniyin Selvan'
168.article_body: Actress Trisha Krishnan said she tried over 50 looks for her character Kundavai in Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "We tried over 50 looks for the film, and later shortlisted around 30 out of them. Later, we picked the best 10 looks from that list, from which Mani Ratnam sir decided what worked for his film," she said.

169.title: 'Rahul, Priyanka are like children to me', Cong leader clarifies her remark
169.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh clarified that some parts of an interview which quoted her as saying, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra don’t give time to senior Congress leaders, were misunderstood. She said many things in her statement were portrayed from different angle. "As an elderly person, I always feel Rahul...Priyanka are like children to me," she added.

170.title: American Express to hire nearly 1,500 tech staff by year-end
170.article_body: American Express Co. has said it is looking to hire around 1,500 people for its technology arm in roles such as software engineers and coders by year-end. Chief Information Officer Ravi Radhakrishnan said nearly 60% of the hires will be in US, a third in India and the rest in Europe. It has added around 3,600 tech employees this year.

171.title: University of North Bengal VC gets CBI custody till Sept 26 in SSC scam
171.article_body: A court has remanded the Vice-Chancellor (VC) of the University of North Bengal, Subires Bhattacharyya, to CBI custody till September 26 in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. Notably, he was earlier the chairman of the West Bengal School Service Commission. CBI claimed that Bhattacharyya was involved in the manipulation of scores of candidates.

172.title: Saw Anushka train for 'Chakda 'Xpress', she's finding it challenging: Virat
172.article_body: Indian cricketer Virat Kohli said he respects how Anushka Sharma has been training for 'Chakda 'Xpress'. The film stars Anushka as cricketer Jhulan Goswami, the former captain of India's national women's cricket team. "She is finding the process challenging. This is the first time she is doing such a thing, and that too by learning bowling," he added.

173.title: BBMP extends deadline of welfare schemes like free laptops, housing subsidy
173.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the last date to apply for various welfare programmes under the municipal corporation from September 19 to October 19. The welfare schemes include subsidy of ₹5 lakh for house construction on own plots, free laptops for undergraduate and postgraduate students, smart sticks for blind persons, educational laptops for blind students, etc.
