We have urged Kremlin to approve the vote at the earliest, the region's Moscow-appointed head Vladimir Saldo informed. Saldo added that he hoped Kherson would become "a part of Russia, a fully-fledged subject of a united country".

350.title: Hyderabad Income Tax Principal Commissioner transferred to Mumbai
350.article_body: Vasundhara Sinha, the Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Hyderabad, has been transferred to Mumbai. This comes amid Income Tax raids across Telangana in connection with the alleged Delhi liquor policy scam. Sinha is a 1988 batch Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. She is the wife of Anjani Kumar, the Director General of the Anti-Corruption Bureau.

351.title: SRK danced in 'Happy New Year' rehearsals with dislocated shoulder: Choreographer
351.article_body: Choreographer Vrushali Chavan revealed Shah Rukh Khan had a dislocated shoulder and an injured knee during the rehearsals of his 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. She said Shah Rukh was walking with the help of a crutch. "When I was teaching him, he would dance like there is no tomorrow...this was during the rehearsals, not even the shoot," Vrushali added.

352.title: Old bridge at Pune's Chandni Chowk likely to be demolished on Sept 25
352.article_body: The old bridge at Chandni Chowk in Pune is likely to be demolished on September 25 (Sunday). Since it's the weekend, there will be less traffic on the Katraj to Dehu road bypass highway and other connecting roads to the chowk. At present, the pre-demolition work is underway and it will be completed by Friday.

353.title: Transport sector key cause of PM2.5, CO emissions in Pune: Report
353.article_body: According to the Emission Inventory Report, the transport sector contributes up to 20% of the emission load of PM2.5 and up to 61% of the emission load of carbon monoxide in Pune. Industries contribute 19% of PM2.5 emission and up to 18% of carbon monoxide emission followed by residential areas at 8% and agricultural waste burning at 5%.

354.title: Delhi govt to start pre-budget planning from October last week
354.article_body: Delhi government will start its pre-budget planning from the last week of October this year. As part of preparations, the Finance Department has sent a proforma to all the departments concerned where they can input data of the revised budget estimates for 2022-23 and estimates for the 2023-24 financial year. The submission must be made on or before October 10.

355.title: Pune residents to move Bombay HC over bad condition of roads
355.article_body: Residents of Pune's Wagholi area have decided to approach the Bombay High Court after allegedly getting no response from authorities to repair damaged roads in the locality. "This dilapidated condition has resulted in several traffic mishaps in the past," a resident said. The Wagholi Housing Societies Association will file a PIL.

356.title: BJP has always cheated youths in the name of employment: Tejashwi
356.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the BJP for allegedly not providing adequate employment to the youths. "BJP, which runs the business of lies and hatred, has always cheated the youths of the country and the state in the name of jobs and employment," Yadav said. He added, "Today 4,325 newly appointed revenue employees will be given appointment letters."

357.title: Michelin star chef Garima to join Vikas, Ranveer in 'MasterChef...': Reports
357.article_body: Michelin star chef Garima Arora is set to join 'MasterChef India 7' as a judge, as per reports. The 36-year-old chef is the first Indian woman to win a Michelin star. This is the first time that the show will have a female chef as a judge. Vikas Khanna and Ranveer Brar will also return as judges on the show.

358.title: Delhi boy wins Collins National Spelling Bee with word 'dialysis'
358.article_body: A Delhi boy, Madhav Kamath, has won the recently concluded Collins National Spelling Bee 2022 with the word 'dialysis'. Thousands of students participated in the competition which took place in Mumbai and the top 36 scorers reached the semi-final, out of which 12 competed against each other in the finale. The winner studies at Delhi's Sanskriti School.

359.title: Lies: Pawar on Maha govt's claims that Vedanta project moved to Guj under MVA
359.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar said Maharashtra government's claims that Vedanta-Foxconn decided to move their plant to Gujarat under Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government's rule are "complete lies". Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis also claimed that a "10% commission" had to be paid under MVA for every subsidy that was announced. "Let [BJP] probe, then things will be clear," Pawar added.

360.title: Man kills self after harassment over repayment of loan in Pune
360.article_body: A 52-year-old man allegedly ended his life on Monday after money lenders harassed him over the repayment of a loan in Pune. The deceased man's wife filed a complaint against seven persons, alleging that they charged exorbitant interest rates, harassed and threatened her husband. Meanwhile, police have booked seven persons under abetment to suicide and arrested four of them.

361.title: Poisoning young minds: BJP on Mufti's remark against hymn in school
361.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina on Tuesday accused Mehbooba Mufti of "poisoning young minds for vested political interests" over her objection to students reciting the 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' in schools in J&K. Mufti is coming out with such a conspiracy to regain her place after having lost her ground in J&K, Raina added.

362.title: Man sued in US for tipping waitress ₹2.3 lakh and then demanding it back
362.article_body: A US man is being sued by Pennsylvania's Alfredo's Pizza Cafe after he tipped a waitress $3,000 (₹2.3 lakh) and later demanded it back. He had challenged the tip with his credit card provider. The restaurant first assumed it was a miscommunication and made attempts to contact him but was unsuccessful. It later filed charges, describing the incident as "aggravating".

363.title: I don't drink or do drugs, but fame has intoxication: Ashneer on Shark Tank
363.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover while speaking about appearing as a judge on Shark Tank India, said, "I don't do drugs, I don't drink, I don't smoke. But fame has an intoxication. It gives you a high." He added, "And that...I can manage and I like." He also claimed that all the sharks came on the show to get famous.

364.title: Education should be in mother tongue: Minister Dharmendra Pradhan
364.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Monday stated that education should be imparted in one's mother tongue. Calling Tamil a national language, he added that the inclusion of Tamil in National Education Policy (NEP) would gradually gain support. He said that Tamil Nadu, which has a great heritage in education, will continue to lead the way in the framework of NEP.

365.title: Pro League will be helpful to prepare ourselves for hockey World Cup: Mandeep
365.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Mandeep Singh said the FIH Pro League, beginning October 28, will be helpful for the team to prepare for World Cup 2023. "It's always good to compete against strong teams before a major competition," he added. The World Cup is set to take place in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela from January 13 to 29, 2023.

366.title: 30% of Bharat Yatris are women; You're seeing new face of Cong: Jairam
366.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said that 30% of the "Yatris" in the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' are "women". "You're seeing a new face of the Congress. They are coming from different states," Ramesh said. He added, "Over 2 lakh people have registered...The Yatra is a tapasya for Rahul [Gandhi] Ji and public response has been in the form of bhakti."

367.title: Contractor to give ₹5 lakh aide to Noida wall collapse victims' relatives
367.article_body: The family members of the four labourers, who died after a boundary wall of a Noida housing society collapsed, will be provided ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each by the contractor, Noida Authority Chief Executive Officer Ritu Maheshwari said. Eight labourers were injured in the incident. Meanwhile, police detained a sub-contractor who supplied the labourers to repair drain in the society.

368.title: India to grow at over 7% in FY23, down from 8% projected in Jan: CEA
368.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said the Indian economy will grow at 7% in FY23, down from the 8-8.5% growth rate projected in January. He said the aftereffects of the COVID-19 pandemic and Russia's invasion of Ukraine are hurting economic growth. India is well-poised to sustain the 7% growth rate for remainder of the decade, he added.

369.title: 2 held for robbing man in Thane, using his credit cards to shop online
369.article_body: Thane Police arrested two persons for allegedly robbing a man of his belongings and using his credit cards to purchase items worth ₹1.6 lakh online, an official said. The incident took place on August 2 when the victim was going home and the accused threw spice powder at him and snatched his four mobile phones and credit cards, police said.

370.title: B'luru civic body extends application deadline for free laptops, housing subsidy
370.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has extended the last date to apply for welfare programmes, including a subsidy of ₹5 lakh for house construction on own plots, free laptops for students, smart sticks for blind persons, educational laptops for blind students and foldable wheelchairs for senior citizens to October 19. The original deadline to apply for the schemes was September 19.

371.title: US court reverses conviction of man in ex-girlfriend's murder case
371.article_body: A US court on Monday reversed the conviction of a man who had been serving a life sentence since 2000 for the murder of his ex-girlfriend. The state attorney of Baltimore City last week asked the court to vacate Adnan Syed's conviction. The prosecution cited discovery of new information and unreliability of incriminating evidence as the reason behind the move.

372.title: 'India won't give any more financial aid to Sri Lanka,' say reports, embassy responds
372.article_body: The Indian embassy in Sri Lanka issued a response after reports said the Indian government will not extend any more financial assistance to Colombo amid an economic crisis. "India has extended unprecedented bilateral assistance amounting close to $4 billion," said the embassy. India is supporting Sri Lanka by promoting long-term investments, scholarships to Lankan students, etc, the embassy added.

373.title: BJP misusing agencies to harass minorities: Ex-Cong MLA Asif Khan
373.article_body: After the arrest of AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan, ex-Delhi Congress MLA Asif Khan alleged the BJP is "misusing" its agencies to "harass" minorities. "I am...against the misuse of agencies, particularly against minorities, by the BJP government," Asif Khan said. Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch on Friday arrested Amanatullah Khan in connection with a corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board.

374.title: Donate money, not flowers and shawls: Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah
374.article_body: Trustee of Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah has appealed to the devotees to donate money instead of flowers and shawls. Many devotees get duped as stale flowers and shawls of substandard quality are sold to them at higher prices, we don't want them to waste their money, trustee Suhail Khandwani said. He added the shrine is undergoing renovation and needs money.

375.title: 2 more arrested for murder of Suresh Raina's uncle & cousin in 2020
375.article_body: Two more people have been arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for their involvement in the murder of cricketer Suresh Raina's 58-year-old uncle and a cousin during a robbery bid in Punjab's Pathankot in August 2020. Raina's uncle was a contractor by profession. Three accused were arrested a month after the incident took place.

376.title: What an experience: Ananya Panday on Ranbir Kapoor's 'Brahmastra'
376.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to Instagram Stories and reviewed Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "What an experience! Fully in love with this world and everyone in it," she wrote. Ananya added that she's "embarrassingly" late to watch the film and urged her fans to watch it. "Whoever is down to discuss fan theories message me," Ananya further wrote.

377.title: AAP gave liquor contract to its candidate Karanjit: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
377.article_body: The BJP alleged that the AAP government ignored all the rules and gave the liquor contract to its candidate, Karanjit Singh Lamba. "It has become clear from the sting operation how Arvind Kejriwal makes a recovery. How they earn black money and how people are looted...AAP gave liquor licence to Kejriwal's close aide," said BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

378.title: WB school students protest at railway station over teachers' transfer
378.article_body: Hundreds of students of a school in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas on Tuesday staged a protest on railway tracks over the transfer of their teachers without notice. "We want our message to reach teachers so we are protesting on rail tracks," the students said. Rail traffic at Gourdaha halt railway station in Canning was affected due to the protest.

379.title: 54,810 Russian soldiers killed, 2,216 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
379.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 54,810 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 2,216 Russian tanks and over 460 aircraft, including 217 helicopters. The ministry said that 4,724 armoured personnel carriers, 1,323 artillery systems and 318 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems have also been destroyed.

380.title: Only she can explain: Saugata Roy on Bengal CM's remark on PM Modi
380.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's "PM not misusing central agencies" statement, TMC MP Saugata Roy claimed that only Mamata Banerjee can explain the political significance of her statement. "The resolution was passed yesterday in the Assembly in which it is said that the CBI and ED are being misused," Roy said.

381.title: Fintech industry should engage more with govt: FM Sitharaman
381.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the financial technology industry should have more engagements with the government and its agencies across all levels. "The greater the engagement, the greater the trust which gets built up," Sitharaman said. She also added that there are also opportunities for fintech players to play a role in the sustainable financial environment.

382.title: Maha govt ends freeze on MIDC's 181 projects amid Vedanta controversy
382.article_body: The Eknath Shinde government has ended freeze on the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation's (MIDC) allotment of 181 land parcels, an official said. Decisions over remaining 10 are also expected soon. The projects were sanctioned by the previous Uddhav Thackeray government. This development comes at a time when the government is facing criticism for a Vedanta project going to Gujarat.

383.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan leaders meet in NY after deadly border clashes
383.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken hosted foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan, Ararat Mirzoyan and Jeyhun Bayramov, in New York. This was the first direct talks between leaders of the two countries since over 170 soldiers were killed in the recent border clashes. Mirzoyan called for "international mechanisms to prevent further escalations", Armenian Foreign Ministry said in a statement.

384.title: Online gaming platform WinZO sues Google over 'unfair' Play Store policy
384.article_body: WinZO has filed a lawsuit in Delhi HC to stop Google from allowing daily fantasy sports, or real-money games for fantasy sports and rummy, on its Play Store app under a pilot project. WinZO said Google's policy excludes a large sector of real-money games, classified as skill-based games, making it "unfair". "[The move will] distort the market," WinZO added.

385.title: Over 90 airports in India to be carbon-neutral by 2024: Union Minister
385.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said over 90 airports in the country will be carbon-neutral by 2024. "In last eight years, number of airports in the country has increased from 74 to 141...this will grow up to 220 in next five years," Scindia added. Currently, the country has 141 airports, of which Kochi and Delhi airports are carbon-neutral, he stated.

386.title: Body of a man found in luggage compartment of Mumbai local train
386.article_body: A body of an unidentified man was found in the luggage compartment of Mumbai's local train at Panvel Railway Station on Tuesday. The deceased is in the age group of 35-40 and his body was spotted by a passenger, police said. The local train where the body was found came from Kurla and was leaving for Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus.

387.title: Moody's withdraws Kalyan Jewellers' rating after fundraise delay
387.article_body: After Kalyan Jewellers India postponed its plans to access the international debt capital markets, rating agency Moody's on Monday withdrew the firm's stable B2 long-term corporate family rating. In April, the company was reportedly planning to raise around $200 million through its subsidiary. Kalyan reported consolidated revenues of ₹10,820 crore and core profit of around ₹850 crore for FY22.

388.title: IAS Shah Faesal withdraws SC plea challenging Article 370 revocation
388.article_body: IAS officer Shah Faesal has withdrawn his petition from the Supreme Court challenging the revocation of Article 370, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir, according to a report. This comes months after Faesal was reinstated in the service earlier this year and appointed Deputy Secretary in the Ministry of Culture. He had quit the government service in 2019.

389.title: Bilkis Bano case witness writes to CJI, says convict told him 'I am out now'
389.article_body: A witness in Bilkis Bano case has written to CJI UU Lalit alleging threats from a convict and expressing fear for his life. Imtiaz Ghanchi said convict Radheshyam Shah purportedly told him, "What did you get by calling me an accused, I'm out now" and laughed. Eleven men convicted for gang-rape and murder in the case were freed last month.

390.title: CWG gold was best moment of my life, playing with Sharath was amazing: Sreeja
390.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula said winning the gold medal in mixed doubles with partner  Sharath Kamal at Commonwealth Games 2022 was the "best moment" of her life. "Playing with Sharath was an amazing experience. He guided me really well during the match," she added. "I'm very happy that I did really well in my maiden Games," Sreeja stated.

391.title: Cong appoints Yuri Alemao as legislature party leader in Goa Assembly
391.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday appointed Yuri Alemao as the leader of its legislature party in the Goa Assembly. This comes days after eight Congress MLAs including Digambar Kamat, Michael Lobo, Delilah Lobo, Kedar Naik, Rajesh Faldessai, Sankalp Amonkar, Rodolfo Fernandes and Aleixo Sequeira joined the BJP. Alemao will lead the legislature party that now consists of three MLAs.

392.title: 14 sperm whales die in mass stranding on Australian beach
392.article_body: At least 14 young sperm whales have died in a mass stranding on a beach in Tasmania in Australia. The whale carcasses were discovered on King Island on Monday afternoon, Tasmania's Department of Natural Resources and Environment said. The incident comes two years after more than 380 pilot whales died on Tasmania's west coast in Australia's worst mass stranding.

393.title: CBI files chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder in bank fraud case
393.article_body: The CBI reportedly filed a chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and Avantha Group Promoter Gautam Thapar in a ₹466.51-crore bank fraud case. Kapoor was not named in the June 2021 FIR, however, his role surfaced during subsequent probes. CBI alleged that the accused had committed criminal breach of trust and conspiracy to divert public money during 2017-2019 period.

394.title: Don't know of anyone who knows Salman but doesn’t like him: Ali Abbas
394.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that he misses working with actor Salman Khan. "I don't know of anyone who knows Salman Khan but doesn't like him," he added. Ali has worked with Salman in 'Sultan', 'Tiger Zinda Hai' and 'Bharat'. "If Salman doesn't like you, he will tell you 'today, I don't like you'," Ali further stated.

395.title: Was changing my niece's dirty diaper when I got a call for 'Avatar': Zoe
395.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana has revealed that she was changing her niece's dirty diaper when she was offered 'Avatar'. "I can't forget getting that phone call from Jim (James Cameron, director) saying, 'I want you to play Neytiri'," Zoe said, adding, "I've never enjoyed a dirty diaper as much as I enjoyed changing that diaper, when I was on...phone with Jim."

396.title: One farmer dying every hour under BJP rule: Congress
396.article_body: The Congress on Tuesday held BJP-led central government's policies responsible for farmers' suicides in the country. "Every day 30 farmers are dying by suicide and every hour more than one farmer is dying," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said while citing NCRB data. This comes after a Pune-based farmer died by suicide over not getting the Minimum Support Price (MSP).

397.title: 50-yr-old labourer killed, wife injured in leopard attack in Gujarat
397.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer from Maharashtra died while his wife was seriously injured after they were attacked by a leopard in Gujarat’s Junagadh on Tuesday, forest officials said. "The man sustained injuries on his neck...and that proved fatal," The Indian Express quoted an official as saying. The incident occurred when the labourer and his wife were asleep in a sanatorium.

398.title: Odisha government increases Dearness Allowance for employees
398.article_body: As a festive gift, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik approved the proposal to increase the Dearness Allowance (DA) by three percent for the state government employees. "Dearness relief for pensioners drawing on a revised rate has also been increased by three percent," the Chief Minister's Office said. The move will benefit nearly four lakh government employees.

399.title: 17 Guj students say teachers call them home for domestic work, run away
399.article_body: Seventeen girl students of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya in Gujarat ran away from school on Sunday after complaining that two teachers were forcing them to come home and do their domestic work. "We have received complaints from class eight students that two teachers are calling them to their homes...even to take care of their children," the school's head teacher said.

400.title: Ukraine using Russian tanks abandoned during counteroffensive: Think tank
400.article_body: Ukraine is deploying left-behind Russian T-72 tanks as it pushes into occupied region of Luhansk, a Washington-based think tank, Institute for the Study of War said. "The initial panic of the counteroffensive led Russian troops to abandon higher-quality equipment in working order," the institute added. Ukraine launched counteroffensive into territory around the second largest city of Kharkiv.

401.title: Will look into it: Aviation Minister on Punjab CM being deplaned for 'being drunk'
401.article_body: Reacting to reports that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was deplaned in Germany's Frankfurt allegedly for being drunk, Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "I will certainly look into it." He said, "The incident took place on international soil. We'll have to make sure that we verify the facts." It was up to Lufthansa airline to provide the data, Scindia added.
